loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to help her yucca crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies and technological enhancements for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena con 57 años de edad es casada, madre de 2 hijos los cuales son 2 mayores en hogares aparte. En su casa de habitación únicamente vive ella y su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura como lo es la siembra y cultivo de café así como también a la apicultura (cría de abejas para la venta de miel). Por más de 10 años ha tenido el negocio de la apicultura pero su mayor fuente de ingresos es del cultivo de café siendo sus clientes las diferentes bodegas, vecinos, familiares, amigos, bodegas de la zona, etc. Ella tiene un grado de estudio de primaria incompleto cursando únicamente sus primeros tres años ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron en su juventud apoyarle. La tierra que ella y su esposo trabajan fue adquirida con mucho esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio ubicada a 20 minutos de su casa de habitación a al cual se trasladan caminando.
Su sueño es seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, mejorar la parcela de tierra que tiene cultivada con una mejor plantilla y poder expandir su tierra por medio de la compra para ser más competitiva en el mercado como el caturra, catuay, que son atractivos para sus clientes de esa forma podrá percibir mayores ingresos para seguir trabajando. Es por ello que el día de hoy ha solicitado a COMIXMUL financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros con los cuales podrá dar un mejor y mayor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María Elena, who is 57 years old, is married and the mother of two children, both of whom are grown and have their own homes.  At her home, it is only her and her husband, who works in agriculture, planting and growing coffee, and in apiculture (keeping bees to sell their honey).  They have had the apiculture business for over ten years, but their main source of income is the coffee crops, as their customers are different markets, neighbors, relatives, friends, local stores, etc.  She has an incomplete primary education, as she only attended school through the third grade because her parents had little money and were not able to support her when she was a child.  She and her husband acquired the land they work through a great deal of hard work and sacrifice; it is located 20 minutes from their home and they get to it on foot.   

Her dream is to keep expanding her coffee crops, improve their cultivated land with better labor, and be able to expand their land by buying so they could be more competitive in the market with varietals such as caturra and catuay, which are attractive to their customers; this would allow them to earn more profit to keep on working.  For these reasons, today she is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy farming supplies, such as manure and fertilizers, among others, which will allow her to provide her coffee crops with more and better care.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una joven de 29 años de edad, quien es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de un solo hijo quien en menor de edad. Uno de los mayores ingresos que percibe su familia es por medio de la producción y cultivo de café ya que su esposo también trabaja por otro lado para poder salir adelante en la parte de construcción cuando hay oportunidad. Ella tiene un grado de educación de secundaria completa por lo que agradece el apoyo de sus padres tanto económico, como moral para haber podido culminar sus estudios. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran dicha actividad pero fue en compañía de su esposo con quien plantaron el cafre que hoy en día atienden. El terreno que juntos trabajan es propio el cual fue obtenido por medio de una herencia por parte de sus padres proyectado hacia el respaldo para sus nietos, hija y demás generaciones el cual está ubicado 300 metros de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando. 
Sus metas, planes y sueños para el futuro es ver su propiedad cultivada con nuevas plantillas de café, productoras y rentables de manera que pueda generar ingresos para poder apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios, y en lo que ella pueda para poder asegurar su futuro. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que su economía y futuro depende de ello.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 29-year-old young woman. She is a farmer, a housewife, and a mother to one child. One of the greatest sources of income for her family is coffee production, since her husband also works in construction when there is the opportunity. She has completed high school. She is grateful to her parents for their financial and moral support, which enabled her to finish her studies. She learnt how to work the land from her parents at a very young age, but it was with her husband that she began planting the coffee that they tend to today. The land they work together is their own, having obtained it through an inheritance from her parents which was designed to support their grandchildren, daughter, and future generations. It is located 300 metres away from their house, and they cover this distance on foot.

Her goals, plans, and dreams for the future are to see her land planted with new coffee seedlings that are fruitful and profitable so that they generate income for supporting Margarita’s son in his studies and ensuring his future. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for purchasing farming supplies, with which she will tend to and maintain her coffee crops, since her finances and her future depend on said crops.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for the maintenance of her coffee crops

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Iris tiene una edad de 50 años, ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos por los cuales agradece a Dios por darle la fuerza para que ellos estudien a nivel superior (universidad). Ella es ama de casa y agricultora, su pareja es quien ayuda en los diferentes trabajos de campo por las tardes y los fines de semana ya que él trabaja como docente en un colegio de la comunidad. Sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia gran parte de los mismos depende de la agricultura siendo esta una fuente de ingreso para sus padres en tiempos anteriores y que en la actualidad no dejan de serlo. Fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad pues por generaciones han sido agricultores especializándose en el café. 
Sus planes para el futuro es ampliar más sus cultivos de café, seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios le permita pues en la actualidad gracias a la buena administración adquirió un pedazo más de tierra la cual esta inculta por lo que planea para este nuevo año el cual va comenzando cultivarla y así poder contar con más tierra, fortaleciendo de esta manera los ingresos y el patrimonio para su hogar y el futuro para sus hijos.   
Por lo que hoy en día solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas los cuales utilizara para dar asistencia técnica la cual incluye: Limpieza, fertilización más la mano de obra de esta forma mejorar la tierra, la planta y el grano para su cosecha.
texts.en:
Iris is 50 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 children.  She thanks God for giving her the strength so that they could study at the college level.  She is a housewife and farmer.  Her husband helps her with the various tasks in the fields in the afternoons and on the weekends, because he works as a teacher in a school in the community.  The income they use to support the family comes mainly from farming; this was a source of income for her parents in previous times, and is still an important source of income for them. It was her parents who taught her to work the land from an early age, as her family has been growing coffee for generations.

In the future, Iris plans to expand her coffee plantations, continuing to work as long as God allows.  At this time, thanks to good management, she has acquired a small additional plot of land that is uncultivated.  This year, she plans on starting to work it so that she can have more land under cultivation.  This way, she can strengthen her income and increase her property for her household and for the future of her children.  This is why she is now requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to invest in agricultural supplies to give technical assistance to her crops.  She will use the funds to clear the land, fertilize it, and to pay for labor to improve the land, the plants, and the coffee beans for her harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor for her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cintia Yulisa

texts.es:
Cintia es una joven de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de una niña de 5 meces de nacida, con un grado de estudio de secundaria completa graduándose como bachiller en Ciencias y Técnico en Computación. Su esposo quien es su apoyo en los ingresos del hogar y del campo trabaja en la municipalidad de la comunidad como contratista en proyectos de agua potable y los fines de semana en el campo junto a su esposa. Los cultivos de café de Cintia son un ingreso más para la familia por más de 3 años la cual fue adquirida con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio que por segunda ocasión espera cosecha. Como madre de familia se esfuerza diariamente por seguir luchando para tener otra clase de ingresos para el bienestar y futuro de su hija.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café lo cual incluye: fertilización, limpieza y la mano de obra reforzando de esta manera sus cultivos para esta temporada. Sus planes para el futuro es seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café pues en la actualidad gracias a la buena administración pudieron comprar junto a su esposo tierra la cual esta inculta y con las ganancias de esta cosecha espera poder cultivarla para el próximo año y así poder contar con 3 manzanas cultivadas ya que en la actualidad es poco lo que tiene, por lo que espera ser apoyada con los fondos KIVA para que sus metas se puedan llevar a cabo.
texts.en:
Cintia is a 25-year-old young woman. She is married and has a five-month-old baby daughter. She finished high school and graduated with a degree in Sciences and Computer Tech. Her husband helps her with their household income. He works for the community as a contractor on potable water projects, and on the weekends he works in the fields alongside his wife. Cintia's coffee plants have been another source of income for her family for over three years. She put a lot of effort and sacrifice into acquiring them, and is now expecting her second harvest. As a mother, she does her best every day to fight for her daughter's wellbeing and future and to find ways to improve their income.

Today she is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL co-op so that she can invest in maintaining her coffee crops. This includes fertilizing, cleaning, and paying for labor so that she can strengthen her plants for the season. 

Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her coffee crops. Currently their good management has allowed her and her husband to purchase unused land, and the profit from this harvest will hopefully allow them to put it to use next year and have five acres planted, which is more than they currently have. She hopes to get the Kiva funds she needs to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, maintain her coffee crops, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist and maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde pequeña se desempeña en los oficios domésticos y la agricultura ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra. En el estudio ella solo pudo cursar hasta el tercer grado ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarla económica mente. Ella es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales los 6 mayores trabajan y los últimos cuatro estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación en la escuela de la comunidad. Junto a su esposo trabajan diariamente y luchan para vestirles, calzarlos, alimentarlos y facilitarle lo que ellos necesiten y ellos como padres puedan darles. Desde hace 7 años se dedica al comercio del café; pero desde los 15 se dedica al trabajo de campo. EL terreno que ella y su familia trabaja es propio gracias al esfuerzo y la buena administración pudieron comprarlo el cual eta ubicado a 15 minutos de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando. Ella sueña con el futuro de sus hijos y verlos convertidos en adultos y profesionales es su meta, como también poder cultivar más producto en su tierra, una mejor variedad, más atractiva para sus clientes que les genera mayores ingresos para poder cumplir sus metas y sueños.
Es por ello que hoy en día ella está solicitando un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 8 QQ de nutricafe, 5 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 3 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de abono foliar, 1 litro de ALTO 10 SL, 5 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 8 QQ de formula cafetalera con lo que asistirá sus cultivos y asegurara su cosecha.
texts.en:
María Carmen is a very hard-working woman who learned from a very young age to take care of household chores and work in agriculture, since her parents were the ones who taught her about farming.  She was only able to get a third grade education as her parents could not afford more.  She is the mother of ten children, six of whom work and the other four attend the local primary school where they are in different grades.

María Carmen and her husband work every day to cloth and feed their children and give them everything they need.  For seven years she has been selling coffee, although she has worked for 15 years in farming.  The cropland belongs to the family and was bought thanks to the efforts and good management of savings.  It is located 15 minutes away from their home so they can walk there.

María Carmen dreams about her childrens' future and wants them to become professionals, and she also wants to farm a wider variety of crops.  This would attract more customers and generate more income so she could meet her goals and accomplish her dreams.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through the COMIXMUL co-op to buy Nutricafe, Formula 18-46-0, urea, plant fertilizer, ALTO 10 SL, Formula 12-24-12 and coffee plant formula for her crops in order to insure a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Doña Modesta tiene una edad de 62 años, casada y madre de 8 hijos quienes están adultos y en hogares aparte, con un grado de estudio cursado hasta el segundo grado. En compañía de su esposo quien es agricultor se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café viviendo únicamente ellos dos en su casa de habitación. Desde muy temprana edad aprendieron gracias a sus padres la siembra y cultivo de café que han sido agricultores desde hace mucho tiempo y por generaciones. Su única fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de café por lo que se esmeran para que estos estén protegidos y cuidados de plagas para evitar trabajar en vano. La tierra que juntos trabajan la adquirieron con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio siendo sus clientes los intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Como desafío encontrado en esta actividad es la baja de precios en el mercado, el problema de plaga y enfermedades como la roya, las escasas lluvias (factor clima), ya que la competencia no es factor problema. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 250 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando involucrándose únicamente ella y su esposo.
Sus planes es comprar más áreas de terreno para seguir cultivando y también si Dios lo permite comprar un vehículo el cual será de gran apoyo para acarreo del producto que cosechan. Su sueño es que cada año su tierra sea más productiva para poder distribuir parte de las ganancias en la mejora de su vivienda la cual necesita arreglos. Por lo que hoy en día Doña Modesta solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes como ser abono, formula cafetalera, nitrato y todo la necesario para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Modesta is 62 years old. She is married and the mother of 8 children who are grown and have their own homes. She has a second grade education. With her husband, who is a farmer, she works growing coffee. The two of them live alone in their house. Since the time they were very young they learned to plant and grow coffee from their parents. Their families have been farmers for generations. Their only source of income is growing coffee and that is why they work hard to care for it and protect it from pests so they won't work in vain. The earth that they work together was acquired with a lot of hard work and sacrifice. Her customers are the intermediaries who go to the area. Challenges in this area are the low market prices, diseases like rust, and scarce rain (the weather). Competition is not a factor. Her crops are 250 meters from her house and they get there walking, just her and her husband.  

Her plans are to buy more land to keep growing and God willing, buy a vehicle to transport the product they harvest. Her dream is for her land to be more productive every year so she can distribute a part of her earnings in improving her home, which needs repairs. That is why Modesta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer such as the coffee formula, nitrate and everything she needs to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help and modernize her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es: Gracias al apoyo financiero brindado por los inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL Doña Rosenda pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para poder asistir sus cultivos de café: abono 12-24-12, foliares, fertilizantes, entre otros que dieron protección, seguridad y tranquilidad a ella y su familia para poder sacar una excelente cosecha. Gracias a su primer financiamiento sus cultivos mejoraron en gran manera tanto en consistencia como en tamaño logrando obtener una buena ganancia la cual le permitió cumplir con su compromiso de pago a tiempo y poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que la cooperativa COMIXMUL ofrece a los pequeños productores con tazas accesibles para poder llevar a cabo los planes y metas propuestas para el desarrollo de sus metas y sus cultivos. Nuevamente Doña Rosenda ha decidido solicitar un segundo financiamiento que le permita comprar una mayor cantidad de insumos agrícolas con la cual protegerá su plantación y asistirá así como también abonara la tierra para poder nuevamente asegurar la producción de café para la temporada y de esa manera lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan ir creciendo y alcanzar sus ideales para el bienestar de su familia y demás seres queridos
texts.en:
Thanks to the financial support of KIVA lenders in alliance with the COMIXMUL co-op, Rosenda was able to buy the supplies she needed for her coffee crop: fertilizer 12-24-12, leaf treatment, and other fertilizers that provided protection, security and tranquility for her and her family aimed at obtaining an excellent harvest.  Because of her first loan the crops improved both in quality and size and earned a good profit allowing her to pay back the loan on time so she can continue enjoying the benefits that the COMIXMUL co-op offers to small producers at low rates so they can carry out their plans and meet the goals they set for their crops.

Once again, Rosenda has decided to request a second loan to buy more farm supplies to protect her plantation and also fertilize the soil once again.  This will insure coffee production for the season so she can earn more income to grow and achieve her goals of well being for her family and other loved ones.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for seasonal treatment of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farming supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ma Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Ma Auxiliadora se encuentra muy feliz y muy satisfecha con el apoyo recibido en su primer financiamiento por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA ya que gracias a ello, ella pudo comprar los insumos necesarios y posibles para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de hortalizas para llevar a cabo el proceso de producción. Doña Ma Auxiliadora en su primer financiamiento logro preparar la tierra para cultivar tres tareas de papa que equivale a 628 metros cuadrados cada una aproximadamente con lo que obtuvo un rendimiento muy efectivo de 40 QQ de papa de primera calidad y logrando 15 QQ de papa de segunda calidad vendiendo todo su producto a muy buen precio con los diferentes intermediarios que llegaron a la zona y otra parte en el mercado local. Gracias a ello afortunadamente consiguió los ingresos esperados para poder salir con su compromiso y posteriormente solicitar un segundo financiamiento como lo es en esta ocasión para poder seguir trabajando y nueva mente comprar más producto e insumos para poder cultivar y poder cosechar una mayor cantidad esperando ser apoyada nuevamente.
texts.en:
Ma Auxiliadora is very happy and satisfied with the support she has received through her first loan through COMIXMUL and with the help of Kiva lenders.  Thanks to them, she was able to buy needed supplies to maintain her vegetable crops and allow her to bring them to harvest.  In her first loan, Auxiliadora was able to prepare her land to support three plots of potatoes (628 cubic meters each).  Through these plots, she obtained a very good harvest amounting to 40 quintals (4 tons) of high quality potatoes and 15 quintals (1.5 tons) of medium quality potatoes.  She was able to sell them at a very good price by selling to different buyers who come to the area and the local market.

Thanks to her profits, she was able to pay back off her loan and is now applying for another.  With this loan, she will be able to continue working and buy more goods and supplies so she can grow and harvest even more than before.  She has the hope of being supported again after this next harvest.

loans.use: buy farming supplies so she can maintain and grow vegetables.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven mujer emprendedora, muy luchadora con mucha energía de 24 años de edad casada y de ella depende una niña la cual es menor de edad y aun no tiene la edad para estar en la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completo que gracias al esfuerzo apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres. Sandra trabaja la agricultura hace más de 5 años actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres mismos que se han dedicado desde toda una vida a esta labor. Ella y su esposo luchan diariamente en la propiedad que le heredo su padre para poder dar su hija un mejor estilo de vida, un mejor futuro y poder brindarle el apoyo necesario y posible en sus estudios y demás necesidades.
Actualmente Sandra solicita ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, para su cultivo de café y para la siembra de un nuevo vivero ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar su cosecha y ampliarla de manera que podrá generar más ingresos y aplicando los insumos evitara que se contamine por la roya enfermedad que daña y destruye los cultivos de café en su totalidad de ser afectados.  
Su meta es poder cancelar su préstamo para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y seguir mejorando su cultivo. Sus sueños como madre de familia es darle a su hija una excelente educación, para que de esa forma tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, sea una persona emprendedora y que algún día ella pueda tener su propio negocio y mejorar su estilo y su calidad de vida. Así como también poder adquirir toda la maquinaria posible para poder hacer el proceso completo que lleva el café para convertirlo en un producto con calidad y dar a este un volar agregado.
texts.en:
Sandra is an enterprising and determined young woman with a lot of energy. She is 24 years old, married, and has a young daughter who is not old enough to attend school. Sandra has completed high school thanks to her parents’ strong moral and financial support. She has worked in agriculture for more than five years. Her parents taught her how as they have spent their whole lives working in agriculture. She and her husband work daily on the land she inherited from her father so they can give her daughter a better lifestyle, a better future, and all possible support in her studies and other needs. 

Sandra is requesting help in order to purchase fertilizer and compost for her coffee crops and for planting a new nursery so she can improve and increase her harvested crops and generate more income. By using the supplies she will be able to prevent her crops from being contaminated with coffee rust, which would destroy her coffee crops entirely if they were affected.

Her goal is to be able to pay off her loan so that she can continue working and continue improving her crops. Her dreams as a mother are to give her daughter an excellent education so that she will have better opportunities in life, be an enterprising person, and one day be able to have her own business and improve her lifestyle and her quality of life. She also wants to be able to acquire as much machinery as possible to complete the process of coffee production and be able to turn her crops into a product of quality and high value.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for and maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Doña Reina es una mujer adulta de 50 años de edad, ama de casa, agricultora y comerciante, madre de 5 hijos quienes son adultos y personas independientes. En su juventud no tuvo la oportunidad para poder estudiar ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos suficientes para apoyarla; pero esos no impidieron que ella pudiese con el tiempo estudiar pues años después entro a la escuela de alfabetización para adultos en donde pudo aprender a escribir y leer. Por varios años doña Reina se ha dedicado a la agricultura ya que a muy temprana edad ella aprendió dicha actividad en compañía de sus padres quienes son agricultores por generaciones teniendo doña Reina una experiencia de más de 21 años. Viendo la forma de cómo generar ingresos para su familia y la crianza de sus hijos ella hace 10 años pensó en abrir una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitación empezando a vender lo básico pues unos años más tarde su negocio es más fuerte y más sólido. También los fines de semana doña Reina se dedica a la elaboración de tamales siendo sus clientes familiares, amigos, vecinos y demás.  
Sus sueños y planes para el futuro seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café, sembrar una nueva plantilla la cual esta lista ya que por medio de esto ella podrá fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos, nietos y próximas generaciones. Por lo que hoy en ida ella solicita apoyo económico para poder ir haciendo sus sueños realidad ya que mediante la compra de insumos agrícolas ella dará asistencia y mantenimiento a la plantación ya cultivada y a la nueva plantilla la cual será sembrada.
texts.en:
Reina is woman of 50, a housewife, farmer and merchant. She is the mother of five children who are adults and independent. In her youth she didn't have the opportunity to go to school, as her parents didn't have sufficient financial resources to help her; but in time that didn't prevent her from going to school, as years later she entered a literacy school for adults where she was able to learn to read and write. 

For several years Reina has worked in agriculture, as at a very early age she learned this occupation from her parents who have been farmers for generations; Reina having more than 21 years experience. Seeing a way to generate income for her family and the raising of her children, 10 years ago she thought of opening a small general store in her home. Starting by selling the basics, a few years later her business is stronger and more established. Also, on weekends Reina makes tamales, her clients being family members, friends, neighbors and others. 

Her dreams and plans for the future are to continue expanding her coffee plantation, to farm a new field ,which is ready, as by this mean she will be able to build a legacy for her children, grandchildren and the next generations.   

So today she is requesting financial help so that she can gradually make her dreams a reality, as by buying agricultural supplies she will look after and maintain the already cultivated plantation and the new plot that will be planted.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to take care of and maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Maria Macaria

texts.es:
María en una joven de 29 años de edad quien se dedica a la agricultura con mucho esmero y entusiasmo en compañía de su esposo encargándose de cultivar, limpiar y abonar la tierra. De su matrimonio tienen tres hijos el mayor asiste a la escuela de la comunidad en su tercer año de educación, los otros dos están pequeños. A muy temprana edad a prendió a trabajar en la siembra y cultivo de café gracias a los conocimientos obtenidos por medio de sus padres quienes le instruyeron en todo lo posible y necesario. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabajan es propio el cual adquirió con mucho sacrificio y trabajando duro ubicado a una distancia aproximada de 5 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando y en ocasiones en vestía.
María tiene como meta la creación de un vivero de café con una cantidad de 20 mil plantillas para poder sembrarlas en su parcela de tierra y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Como madre de familia sueña con ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mayores oportunidades las cuales puedan ser positivas y beneficiosas para sus vidas. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para poder comprar insumos agrícolas y darle asistencia técnica necesaria a la cosecha  de café para el cual debe comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros ya que así su cosecha y producción será mejor y mucho más beneficiosa.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year-old young woman who works in agriculture with a great deal of effort and enthusiasm. Alongside her husband, she sows, clears and fertilizes the land. From their marriage they have three children, the eldest of whom attends the third grade of the local school and the other two are the little ones. She learned to sow and grow coffee at a very young age, thanks to the knowledge that was passed on by her parents, who taught her everything they could and everything she needed to know. She and her husband own the plot of land where they work, and they acquired it through a great deal of sacrifice and hard work. It is located approximately 5 kilometers from their home and they get there by walking and occasionally by riding animals.
María's goal is to grow a coffee nursery with some 20,000 plants so that she can sow them on her plot of land and strengthen her estate for her children's sake. As a mother, she dreams of seeing her children in better living conditions, with better opportunities that may be positive and beneficial to their lives. That's why she's currently requesting a loan in order to purchase farming supplies and get technical assistance which is needed for her coffee crops. She has to buy fertilizers, compost, liquid fertilizers, etc., so that her crop and her produce will be better and much more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to use on her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
María Lucrecia es una joven luchadora de 21 años de edad, emprendedora descendiente de una familia muy humilde pero muy trabajadora, dedicada a su trabajo quien vive junto con su esposo y su único 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad.  Junto a su esposo se dedican a las actividades de reconstrucción sobre el cultivo de café que está sembrado y dañado así como también a la producción del mismo ya que tienen una pequeña parcela total mente productora. Ella aprendió a trabajar en el campo a muy temprana edad siendo sus padres quienes le instruyeran y le enseñaran las diferentes técnicas para llevar a cabo dicho trabajo. También cultivan granos básicos como el maíz y frijol en pequeña escala estando ubicada su parcela de tierra a  1 kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente. María Lucrecia tiene un grado de estudio de primaria incompleta la cual pudo cursar hasta el cuarto grado ya que por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres no pudo continuar. 
Sus sueños educar a su hijo, darle las mayores oportunidades en la vida para que él pueda estudiar y obtener mayores conocimientos que ayuden al desempeño y desarrollo en su vida profesional, así como también a la integración en la sociedad para formar empresas y demás que ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita apoyo económico para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus propios cultivos de café ya que en estos tiempos se necesita asistir bien la plantación debido a tanta contaminación, plagas, y enfermedades que brotan y destruyen la cosecha en general.
texts.en:
María Lucrecia is a hardworking, 21-year-old young woman.  She is ambitious and comes from a humble but hardworking family.  She is also very dedicated to her work.  She lives with her husband and their young son.

Together with her husband, they work restoring their already planted but damaged coffee trees.  They also work growing coffee trees on their 100% fertile land.  She learned to farm at a young age from her parents who taught her the different techniques necessary for carrying out this work.  In addition, they grow basic foods on a smaller scale such as corn and beans.

Their land is one kilometer from their house and they walk to get there every day.  María Lucrecia has an incomplete, 4th grade education due to her parents not having enough money to allow her to continue.

Her goals include putting her son through school and giving him greater opportunities for his life.  She wants him to be able to study and gain knowledge that will help him to carry out and develop his life in a professional career.  In addition, she wants him to use his endeavors to integrate into society and improve his quality of life.

For all these reasons, María Lucrecia is asking for financial support to buy manure and fertilizer so as to tend to her coffee crops.  It is important to care for her crops well due to the current prevalence of many diseases that are capable of infecting and destroying coffee trees.

loans.use: buy farming supplies to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es:
Doña Maria de 45 años de edad es una mujer luchadora, fuerte y con un deseo inmenso de superarse ya que a pesar de la edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ama de casa y agricultora que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron las diferentes técnicas y métodos para poder cosechar y cultivar café siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y hogar y que en la actualidad no es la excepción. En su hogar únicamente viven su esposo y sus cuatro hijos siendo los dos mayores apoyo y ayuda necesaria en la producción y mantenimiento del café así como también la aplicación de abono, foliares, limpieza, etc. y los últimos dos uno esta en la escuela cursando el segundo año de primaria y el mas pequeño es el que carga en sus brazos de meses de nacido. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados en el mismo predio donde esta construida su humilde hogar permitiendo estar mas al pendiente de su familia y de sus cultivos. 
Sus metas y sueños poder cultivar una manzana mas de tierra con un tipo de café diferente para ofrecer en el mercado otra producto ya que de esa forma sus ingresos mejoran, tendrá mayores ganancias y ayudara a que los estudios de sus hijos puedan completarse asegurando su futuro y el de sus próximas generaciones. Por lo que Maria solicita apoyo económico para la compra de fertilizante, abono, entre otros que ayudaran a asistir la cosecha de este año haciendo de esta mas segura y mas productiva. De esta manera se podrá controlar la plaga que afecta a la planta de café también pretende contratar personal que ayude de la limpia de la plantación y así ganar mas tiempo y llevar a cabo las cosas de manera eficiente.
texts.en:
Maria, 45 years old, is a hard working and strong woman who has an immense desire to get ahead since, despite her age, has not stopped dreaming big. A housewife and farmer since she was young, her parents taught her different techniques and methods to be able to harvest and grow coffee, since this is the main source of income for the wellbeing of her family and home and today is no exception. In her home live her husband and their four kids. The two eldest support and help with production and maintenance of the coffee as well as application of fertilizer and cleaning. Of the other two, one is in school in the second grade and the other small one is in her care at home, only months old. Her crops of coffee are located in the same property where her humble home is constructed, allowing her to be near her family and her crops.

Her goals and dreams are to be able to grow a block more of land with a different type of coffee to offer another product in the market since, in this way, her income will improve and she will have greater earnings and will help her children complete their education, assuring their future and that of the next generation. Maria is requesting economic support for the purchase of fertilizers, among other things, that will help her attend to this year's crop, making it more certain and productive. In this way, she will be able to control the blight that affects the coffee plant, as well as hire people who help with cleaning the plantation and gain more time to accomplish things more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Afig

texts.en:
Afig, a driver, is 32 years old and married with a child. He and his family have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli City for 21 years.  They now live at Mahmudlu Village of the Fuzuli region near the war zone. In this zone conditions of life are very difficult. 

It was noted that Afig is a driver. Today he wants to repair his car. For this reason Afig needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Afig is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the aid.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan lives in Jrarat village with her husband and two daughters. She is a farmer with many years of experience of running a farm. She keeps three cows and cultivates wheat, potatoes and some greens. She works hard to run her farm in a sustainable way and gather enough income for her family. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Hayastan asks for 2,000 USD to pay for land rental service. The land where she makes cultivation is not her own so she has to rent it. Since the spring is a great season for cultivation, she asks for financial support to be able to pay for land rental. 

Hayastan will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for land rental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for poultry production.

loans.name: Nadom Group

texts.en:
Naomi is the representative of this group 'Nadom' (his grace). Her group is located in Dansoman-Accra. She makes her home here in Dansoman with her husband and three children.

The group is into second hand clothing, ground nuts, kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish and tailoring.

Naomi is excited to be taking her sixth loan from ID-Ghana after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expand her business. She has had her business for five years, starting with her first loan with which she bought a bale of second hand clothing and sold it to customers. 

Naomi plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses to increase her inventory by purchasing two bales of second hand clothing from the main market and sell them to customers. 

Naomi will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and provide for her family, thus helping her partner. She wants to build her own house and have all her family together in a better house.

The group will need a total amount of 5,000 GHS to buy enough and serve customers better.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of second hand clothing from the main market and sell them to customers

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in Khashtarak village with her husband and two children, ages 12 and 10 years old. Her father-in-law is a migrant worker in neighboring country and he works hard to gather enough income for the family. Qristine's husband is in construction by profession and he sometimes receives orders from his co-villagers. 

Qristine has been engaged in agriculture. She keeps 20 chickens, and cultivates corn, potatoes, and forage. The family owns an agro-machine which is used for gathering the harvest. Now, the machine is not in working condition and Qristine has no financial resources to repair it. 

She has applied for this loan of USD 350 to be able to make renovations of the agro-machine. The loan will be very helpful to Qristine and she will be very grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of  the agro-machine.

loans.name: Kyambura Bakyara Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Zabibu is a member of Kyambura Bakyara Tukwatanise Group and a mother of five children aged between twelve and twenty-two years. Zabibu also looks after four other children who are orphans to her late brother. She is determined to see all her biological children and the four orphans through school. 

Zabibu is a businesswoman trading in bananas, a business she started in 1996 with the purpose of getting money, which she would use to develop her family. Her business is located in the Kyambura trading centre and the people in the trading centre are her major customers. 

Zabibu works throughout the week and when she is away from her stall, she is in the field looking for markets. Her hard work and her honesty in business have helped her greatly to grow the business; by doing this she gains customer loyalty. 

Zabibu is challenged by the stiff competition in the area she operates in but she is hopeful that if she gets a loan she will be able to buy more stock and make bigger sales, which will help her business to grow to greater heights. 

Pictured is the group, but the lady at the extreme right is the area Councillor who mobilized the group. Although she is not taking the loan, she signed the waiver for it. She thanks UGAFODE for serving the needs of her community.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Dragisha

texts.en:
Dragisha is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He is working for a medical clinic, and his wife stays at home caring for their children. They live with his parents, who receive a pension. 

In addition, Dragisa also keeps cows to provide extra income to his family, as well as nutrition. The stable that he has is very old and needs renovation, so he is requesting a loan in order to build a new one and purchase food for the cows. 

He hopes in the future to add more cows and sell the extra milk, and continue to improve their income in this manner. He would like to thank all of the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to build a new stable.

loans.name: Zoran

texts.en:
Zoran is 57 years old, married and has an 18-year-old child. He is working as a dental technician and his wife is a doctor. Although they live in an area where the war has caused unemployment, they are happy that they are still employed even with their low salaries. 

Zoran is in need of a loan in order to repair his roof. He has not been able to save the money so far and meet the daily expenses of his family. He is requesting 1,500 EUR and hopes that the loan will improve the living conditions of his family. Zoran and his wife are very happy and would like to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair his house roof.

loans.name: Seljatin

texts.en: Seljatin is aged 32, has one daughter and is married. He is working in a municipality but with a very low salary and also receives social help while his wife stays home with their daughter taking care of the home and her needs. They live in a very poor community in an old home that has needed renovations for a very long time. He is requesting a loan to renovate the flooring and to replace their main door. He hopes that the loan will improve their living conditions, as his goal is to give his child a better education. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate the flooring and replace their main door.

loans.name: Ilmi

texts.en:
Ilmi is 48 years old and a married father of three. His wife is a stay-at-home-mother caring for the children and the home. In order to earn a living, he works in construction and also plants different vegetables on the land that he owns. 

It’s clear that he is a hardworking man, balancing two jobs and a family. He plants the vegetables in attempt to reduce his family’s expenses and add extra income to their household. Now he is asking for a loan so he can install a water system to irrigate the vegetables when there is a lack of rain, which is common in his region. He is very happy to have an opportunity to take a loan and hopes for a better future for his family and children. He would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to install a water system to irrigate the vegetables.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling oranges, passion fruits and onions. 

Joweria has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of passion fruits, oranges and onions. She has been in this business for seven years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on wholesale only. 

Joweria’s major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to sell wholesale and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more  bags of passion fruits, oranges and onions

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik lives in Kapan town where she works at a local kindergarten. Nazik is a mother of two grown up children. The whole family is involved in agriculture. They are involved in beekeeping and have 30 colonies of bees. With the help of her husband, Nazik gets high-quality honey which they sell to locals in Kapan town. 

As the honey is of high demand among local people in Kapan town, Nazik would greatly like to enlarge her business activity. Nazik has applied for this loan to purchase materials for renovating the colonies of bees, including desks and paints. She will be very grateful to lenders for supporting her business and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for renovating the colonies of bees including desks and paints.

loans.name: Gagawala Group

texts.en: Jane is a second time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) applying for a loan.  Her previous loan was 500000=.  She is widow with three children, who all go to school. She runs a salon in Nsabya Kilombe.  She borrowed the loan in order to buy more cosmetics and weaves for her salon.  She has a good character and her plan and dream is to complete her rental rooms in order to be able to earn more money and increase her incomes. She is so grateful for the help offered to them. The lady on the extreme right is the UGAFODE staff.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and weaves for her salon.

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is 56 years old and married with two children. He is working on the railway while his wife stays at home to care for the house and their children. They live in a minority community where the unemployment rate is very high, so although Milan is lucky to have a salary from working, they are still very poor and there is not enough to meet their daily needs and be able to save money for other necessities that arise. 

This is the case with his home which his very old and in desperate need of renovations that he has never been able to complete. Now he is requesting a loan to do the general renovations including the flooring and replacing the windows and doors. He is very happy to have the opportunity to be able to improve the living conditions and overall wellbeing of his family. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to do general renovations including the flooring and replacing the windows and doors.

loans.name: José Baltazar

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el cantón, solamente estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, su compañera de vida se dedica al trabajo doméstico y solo ellos tres viven en casa.

José es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseñó a cultivar maíz, sandia y chiles pero José actualmente solo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y sandia. El lugar de trabajo está a una distancia de 10 minutos de su casa, tiene un horario de 6:00 AM hasta 12:00 MD pero siempre está pendiente del cultivo de sandía durante todo el día.

El crédito lo necesita para el pago del alquiler del terreno donde cultivará sandias, preparar la tierra, para el pago de mozos, comprar las semillas de sandía y los fertilizantes que necesitará para lograr una buena producción, José cubrirá esta necesidad con la ayuda del crédito y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida mediante las ganancias que obtenga.

Sus planes a futuro son mejorar la producción de sandía y tener más clientes a quien venderles, además con las ganancias mejorar su casa para brindarle a su familia un lugar seguro. 
Él sabe que con su trabajo y esfuerzo podrá cumplir sus metas y ser un buen ejemplo para su hijo.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old. He lives in town. He only studied until the 3rd grade. He is in a relationship and has a two year-old son. His life companion does domestic work for a living and only the three of them live in the house.

José is a young entrepreneur that has been in agriculture for a living for a short time. He learned this trade from his father who taught him to cultivate corn, watermelon and peppers, but today José only grows corn and watermelon. His place of work is 10 minutes from his home. He has a schedule of 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM but he is always tending to the cultivation of watermelon during the day.

The loan he needs is to pay to rent the land where he will cultivate watermelon, prepare the land, pay porters, to buy watermelon seeds and the fertilizer he will need to have a good production. José will cover this need with the help of the loan and he will be able to improve his quality of life through the income that he obtains.

His future plans are to improve watermelon production and have more customers to whom he can sell. With the income he also plans to improve his home to provide his family a secure place.

He knows that with his effort and work he will be able to meet his goals and to be a good example for his son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay to rent land and for manual labor to cultivate watermelon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new stocks of clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Samah

texts.en: Samah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.  Samah is a 29-year-old, single lady, from Deir el Balah city.  She lives with her family in a small simple house. Samah works as an employee in a local firm. She helps her family with part of their expenses. Her brother wanted to open a store and start his own business for selling birds.  It’s the only one in the city.  Samah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her brother to buy more birds for his store to resell. By taking this loan, the store sales will be increased and also the family income.

loans.use: to help her brother to buy more birds for his store to resell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, es madre de 3 hijos, es soltera y vive con su madre de 73 años, quien le ayuda en el cuidado de sus hijos.
Carmen vive en el barrio 9 de octubre de san Lorenzo se dedica actualmente a criar aves de corral como pollos, patos y pavos, para luego comercializarlos en la comunidad por libra y enteros.
Carmen vivio una infancia muy dificil y por esta razon decide promover una actividad que le genere ingresos economicos, es asi que Ella ha improvisado un corral en el patio de su casa, ella espera con este préstamo, comprar más aves y alimentos. Es una persona emprendedora y está segura de crecer en este negocio con el préstamo solicitado.
Desde ya agradece a los socios kiva por la confianza en su trabajo.
texts.en: Carmen, who is single, has 2 sons and 1 daughter.  She lives with her 73-year-old mother, who helps her by looking after the children. Carmen lives in the barrio 9 de octubre in San Lorenzo and now runs a business breeding poultry such as chickens, ducks and turkeys in her yard.  She hopes to use the loan to buy more birds and food. She is an enterprising person and is sure that she can expand her business with the aid of the loan she has applied for. She is, therefore, grateful to Kiva members for believing in her and what she does.

loans.use: to buy more birds and food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and potato and pea seeds

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Desde hace más de 12 años  vive en San Lorenzo, Amparo, ella tiene 51 años es casada vive con su esposo, 4 hijos y 2 nietos. Ella se dedica al cuidado de su familia y a su negocio (tienda de arroz azucar, aceite pollo, carne, platano).
Su esposo le ayuda diariamente con las ventas y con el cuidado de sus nietos.
Amparo, es una mujer impulsadora, optimista y emprendedora, con este préstamo, comprará más arroz, azúcar, aceites y productos lácteos para surtir más su despensa. 
Su familia goza de buena salud y los más chicos asisten a clases, Amparo está muy orgullosa de sí misma porque ha podido atender a su familia y ofrecerle días mejores, gracias al apoyo de Fodemi y a quienes sin conocerles nos prestan su dinero para poder trabajar.
Desde ya agradece por este apoyo a todos los inversionistas de KIVA
texts.en:
Amparo has lived for over 12 years in San Lorenzo. She is 51 and lives with her husband, four children, and two grandchildren. Amparo cares for her family and manages her business (a grocery store). Her husband helps her sell groceries at the store and care for their grandchildren. 

Amparo is an energetic, entrepreneurial and optimistic woman. She will use funds from this loan to purchase additional rice, sugar, oil and dairy products to boost her store's inventory. 

The members of Amparo's family are all in good health and the youngest children attend school. Amparo takes great pride in having met her family's needs and offered them a better life. She is grateful for the help of FODEMI [Fondo de Desarrollo Microempresarial, Microenterprise Development Fund] and the anonymous lenders who loan money to strangers so that these small business entrepreneurs can work. Amparo would like to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice, sugar, oil, and dairy products to boost her store's inventory.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Yenoqavan village with her husband and two children aged 18 and 10 years. Her husband is a seasonal migrant worker in a neighbouring country. During the months that he is here in Armenia, he assists his wife with running a farm. The farm includes livestock of cows, 14 oxen and 30 chickens. The family also owns a plot of land where Marine cultivates wheat, grass and some fruit trees. 

Now, among numerous maintenance problems with her farm, Marine wants to solve the one that is the most urgent. She wants to purchase animals (12 oxen) and increase her agricultural income. She asks for this loan of 1,200 USD and will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for 12 oxen.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana, vive con sus padres y hermanos en uno de los barrios más vulnerables de San Lorenzo, es soltera de 30 años tiene una niña de 7 años que ya asiste a la escuela.
Diana por varios años se ha dedicado a la cría y venta de pollos, y en los últimos meses ha comercializado chancho, por esta razón, Diana desea con este préstamo, comprar más chanchos  para incrementar sus ganancias y con estas ventas, ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos de su hija en la escuela.
Diana desea que su nena pueda seguir una carrera en la universidad y verla profesional en un futuro.
texts.en:
Diana lives with her parents and siblings in one of the most vulnerable neighborhoods in San Lorenzo.  She's single and has a daughter, 7, who's already attending school.

Diana has worked for several years raising and selling chickens, and in the past few months has sold pigs.  This is why she wants to use the loan to buy more pigs and chickens to increase her sales and profits, help her family, and cover her daughter's school expenses.

Diana wants her daughter to go to college and become a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Vendiendo pescado frito en el barrio 12 de octubre en San Lorenzo, encontramos a Fidela, mujer divorciada de 53 años con 6 hijos quienes ya han formado su hogar. 
Vive sola,  en la mañana visita a su madre, compra pescado para prepararlo y venderlo frito en horas de la tarde.
Con este crédito, Fidela a mas de vender el pescado frito, comprara pescado grande para venderlo en el mercado a buen precio. 
A Fidela le gusta mucho visitar a los niños en las guarderías, lleva obsequios y juega con ellos.
Lleva varios préstamos con Fodemi  y está contenta realizando sus ventas por que tiene muchos amigos, dice que desde muy lejos viene a comprarle el pescado frito, porque es muy rico.
texts.en:
Selling fried fish in the 12 de Octubre neighborhood of San Lorenzo, we meet Fidela, a fifty-three-year-old divorcee with six children who have started their own homes.
She lives alone. She visits her mother in the mornings. She buys fish to prepare and she fries it and sells it in evenings.
With this loan, Fidela will go to the market to buy fish at a good price, which she will sell.
Fidela is fond of visiting children at nursery schools; she brings them gifts and plays with them.
She has several loans with Fodemi, and she is pleased with her sales because she has many friends. She says that they come a great distance to buy her fried fish because it's very delicious.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila está casada, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus 4 hijos, ella tiene 66 años de edad y se dedica a crianza de chanchos  gallinas de raza rruna que son muy consumidas por los habitantes de la ciudad, comenta que se siente feliz y muy tranquila criando sus animales porque de esta forma obtiene ingresos para la compra de alimentos y de medicamentos ya que manifiesta que ella aun puede trabajar y no quiere ser una carga para sus hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y entre ellos se ayudan mutuamente. 
Ella aspira que su negocio crezca y de esta manera aumenten sus ingresos para tener el dinero que sustente sus gastos.
texts.en:
Zoila is married and lives with her husband and one of their four children.  She is 66 years old and raises pigs and a special breed of chicken that is very popular among the local people.  She says she is very content raising animals because she is able to earn an income to buy food and medicine.  She says she is still able to work and does not want to be a burden on her children.  Her husband is a farmer and they help each other mutually.

Zoila wants to grow her business and earn more income to cover expenses.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Arístides

texts.es:
Arístides tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el cantón y está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa pero también atiende una tienda familiar que ellos poseen, tienen un hijo de 5 años edad y solo ellos 3 viven en la casa, Arístides, su hijo y su compañera de vida que son los únicos que dependen de él.

Arístides es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a diversas actividades, es agricultor, desde pequeño se ha dedicado a realizar esta labor, lo aprendió de su padre pues él le enseñó a realizar este trabajo, además siembra sandías, actividad que le ha permitido mantener económicamente su familia. 
Además él posee un vehículo con el cual realiza viajes hasta la ciudad, esto le permite tener ingresos adicionales, también su compañera de vida atiende la tienda familiar que tienen en su casa, ellos venden productos de la canasta básica. Para la siembra de maíz y sandía, Arístides debe hacer un recorrido de 20 minutos a pie. 

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertirlo en la preparación del terreno para la siembra de sandias, para el pago de mozos que le ayudarán en la siembra, para comprar las semillas de sandias y los fertilizantes que sean necesarios. 
Como Arístides se dedica también a la siembra de maíz, parte del dinero lo invertirá para la preparación de la tierra para dicho cultivo, de esta manera él podrá obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para mantener a su familia a través de las ganancias de la siembra.

Este joven sueña con seguir cultivando la tierra, cada año mejorar su producción de sandias y maíz para que le permita tener más ingresos, y además ayudar a los mozos dándoles trabajo temporal.
texts.en:
Arístides is 25 years old and lives in the canton. His partner is a housewife and also tends to the family store they own. They have a 5-year-old child and the three of them live together at home. Both his son and his life partner depend on Arístides.

Arístides is a young entrepreneur who is engaged in various activities. He has been a farmer since childhood when his father taught him how to do this work. He plants watermelons, an activity that has enabled him to support his family economically. He also has a vehicle that he makes trips to the city with, allowing him to have additional income. His life partner also tends to the family store in their home where they sell basic needs products. To plant the corn and watermelon, Arístides must do a 20-minute walk on foot.

The loan he is asking through CrediCampo is needed to invest in preparing land for planting watermelons, to pay farmhands to help with planting, and to purchase watermelon seeds and fertilizer as needed. As Arístides also plants corn, some of the money will be invested for the preparation of the land so he can get the necessary income to support his family through earnings from planting.

This young man dreams of continuing farming each year to improve his production of watermelons and corn, to allow him to have more income, and to help young farmhands by giving them temporary work.

loans.use: to plant watermelon and corn, pay farmhands, and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad used his previous loan to buy poultry seeds which increased his production and profits.

He has a poultry farm project which he has been engaged with for more than five years. He says he has a ready market for his eggs and broilers in Kawanda Mattuga and other areas, and thus finds no problem with supply. Muhammad’s clients' demand has increased, but he is unable to meet them. He is thus applying for a loan to boost and meet all the demands through buying enough feed and buying more birds.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and to buy more birds.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is 34 years old and married with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and raises children. The members of the family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. He is a farmer and has worked in this field for eight years. He raises seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, potatoes, tomatoes, greens, etc.) and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly salary is 100 AZN and unfortunately, it’s not enough to provide for his family and cover their demands.

Taleh has worked at farming for a long time and knows that people prefer fresh vegetables grown without pesticides. He sells his food as cheaply as possible because he knows that people in IDP settlements are very poor. They use vegetables in everyday cooking (soups, fried vegetables, etc.).

Taleh needs to increase his income because it’s hard for his family living in IDP settlement. He applied for 2,000 AZN to buy new vegetables and seeds to raise fruit trees. He hopes that one day he will be able to make his family’s life better than it is at the present time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and seeds

loans.name: Vusalagha

texts.en:
Vusalagha is 22 years old and single. He is a refugee and has lived in an IDP settlement since his own village was occupied. He earns 200 AZN monthly selling mobile telephones and has worked in this area for three years. Hi leaves early in the morning to go to the neighboring city every day in order to earn money and cover his living expenses somehow. 

In modern life, people use mobile telephone for everything. They use them to call someone, send a message, take a photo or take a video. They use them when they need to calculate something. People have a high demand for this kind of technique. 

Unfortunately, Vusalagha’s salary isn’t enough to cover his demands. He needs to repair his house as it’s in a bad condition because of serve weather.  He applied for 2,000 AZN in order to supply new models of mobile phones and expand his shop’s assortment.

loans.use: to buy new models of mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel lives in Bundibugyo. He is married, with four children and he is currently 39 years old. He deals in a cocoa business and he has additional activities, like brick-laying and farming as other sources of income for he and his family. The business has been in operation for ten years. 

Abel dreams of increasing his stock of capital with the loan he will get, even if he is facing a challenge of seasonality and price fluctuations. He is strong and keeps time a factor, which is good for business operations. 

Abel will use the loan to buy and sell his cocoa to Esco, a leading cocoa company in town.

loans.use: to buy and sell cocoa.

loans.name: Dakhil

texts.en:
Dakhil is twenty-four years old and married with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper. The main source of young family's income is Dakhil's job. For the past 2 years, he has worked in a water project building a new canal for houses, fields and gardens in the area. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Water is one of the most important things in a human's life. We use water daily for drinking, washing and growing foods. We can't live without it. Dakhil knows this and tries to do his best in order to build this canal properly. 

He has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy tools and materials for building the canal system. During last two years he has learned about everything in this area and now knows which materials are good and high quality.

loans.use: to supply tools and materials for an irrigation system

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is an 18-year-old boy, still single with no child. He has been in the retail business for three years though he earns a side income from cocoa farming. His market segment are the people around him in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Despite his hard work, Daniel is faced with the challenge of bad debtors when he sometimes transacts with them on credit basis, thus reducing his profit margin and hindering business growth. He has asked for a loan to add more stock to his shop. He dreams of becoming a rich man with a bright future ahead of him.

loans.use: to add more stock to his shop.

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
Alida is a 23-year-old married woman and has a son. The members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. The young family gets earnings from gardening. Alida raises seasonal fruit trees and a few kinds of vegetables. She sells them at the local bazaar and makes 250 AZN monthly for this. Over three years of working in the field, she has developed strong skills. They get additional income from her husband, who works in a bank.  

Azerbaijan people have a high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables. They like to eat fresh fruits or use them to prepare delicious fruit pies. They use vegetables to cook national dishes, such as fried eggplant or fried tomatoes with meat, greens and spices. 

Alida's child is growing and his parents want to provide him with a happy childhood and an excellent future education. Unfortunately, the family's income isn't enough to do this. So, Alida applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to supply new kinds of fruits and vegetables. She plans to expand her business and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to supply other kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kahondero

texts.en: Kahondero is a 56-year-old man, married with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in a sugar cane planting business that he has been operating for 15 years.He obtains additional income from maize and Irish potato growing. He started his business to get more income for educating his children and to provide for basic needs. He is faced with a lack of capital to expand his sugar cane plantation farm to a larger estate, and for paying workers. Kahondero intends to use this loan to pay for labour in his sugar cane plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labour in his sugar cane plantation.

loans.name: Most Holy Group

texts.en:
Solomon is one of the members of the group Most Holy. This group is located in the Dansoman-Accra community surrounding. They are four borrowers who are businessmen and businesswomen. He has been selling phone credit for different networks. 

Solomon is excited to be taking his fifth loan from ID Ghana. He has had his business for almost four years. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing different credit cards and selling them to customers. He has a very wide range of customers. He will use his profits to invest in his business and to save. His group need a total amount of 3,300 GHS to buy enough and serve their customers better. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase different phone credit cards to sell to customers.

loans.name: Khazar

texts.en:
Khazar is a 22-year-old single IDP and lives with his parents in an IDP settlement. He tries to cover his living expenses by working as a farmer. He raises seasonal fruits (such as apples and pears.) and vegetables (such as greens, onion, and potatoes). He has four years of experience and his monthly salary is 120 AZN.

Khazar is a hardworking man. He knows that he has to earn money and help his old and ill parents. Due to his skills, he knows that people prefer fruits and vegetables raised without pesticides. They like eating them fresh or cooked in something delicious.

Khazar plans to increase his income because he wants to get a chance to have a higher education and to provide his parents and himself with a happy life. He applied for 2,000 AZN to build a greenhouse for his garden. Khazar believes that he will be able to make his dreams of a happy life come true.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Sadije

texts.en:
Sadija is a 56 widowed mother with three sons. At that time all three of them went to school and she was not able to work because she needed to care for her children and her family. She has had a very difficult time raising them alone and without the support or help from her husband but they now work very hard in construction to help provide for the family needs. 

The house that they live in is very old and she has never been able to complete the renovations that it needs. She is now requesting a loan in order to finally get them completed so that she can improve the living conditions of her family.  She hopes that soon she will be able to have some grandchildren and see them have a better life as well. She promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Vian

texts.en: Vian, who lives in Hoima, Uganda, is a 32-year-old man charged with the responsibility of taking care of his three children and wife. He earns additional income from a motorcycle transportation business (boda-boda). As a hardworking man, he saved and started buying and selling produce. Price fluctuation and competition hinders the business. He desires to buy a personal car. Vian wants a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is a Ghanaian artisan who creates hand-carved wood items, such as masks and sculptures. He would like to stock up on wood, polish and sandpaper for his wood carvings. Kwadwo has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story: "I developed a love for carving at a tender age. My late uncle was a very skillful carver. I used to sit with him at his workshop to observe how he went about his carving, when I returned from school. I just loved the beautiful items he carved along with other carvers at his workshop. He would sometimes give me pieces of wood to try my hand at sandpapering and I worked with him for 15 years. Before he passed on, he handed over his workshop to me and, since then, I have continued to produce quality items just as I was trained. It took hard work, determination and consistent practice to become a master of this art. Now I train people." "I will be very thankful to all of you for helping me get money to produce my designs. Thank you so much!" Use the link below to view Kwadwo's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/9091

loans.use: to stock up on wood, polish and sandpaper for his wood carving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and material for her work.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en: Remegio is aged 29 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his two children and wife. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He earns additional income from hawing machines and farming. He saved salary from work in the private sector as a teacher and started his business. Price fluctuation and competition hinders the business. He desires to build and finish his house. Remegio has asked for a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en: Afrim, who is 52 years old and a married father of four adult children, lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo which is very poor and primarily considered a minority community. His wife is a housewife and he is involved in tending to cows and has a vineyard. He loves his job and is able to not only consume the milk and the milk products, but able to earn a living by selling them locally. Right now he is in need of a loan in order to purchase food for the cows so he can continue to care for them. In the future he would like to expand his farm even more so that he can offer a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase food for the cows so he can continue to care for them

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is 49 years old and a married father with adult children living in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. He has been actively involved in agriculture for a long time, keeping cows and calves for generating income. From the cows, he is able to sell the milk and other dairy products and he is able to sell the calves to other people in his neighbourhood. 

He is very well known in his area and is very satisfied with his business and the income he receives from it, which is enough to meet his family's needs and allow for his wife to stay at home and care for the house. At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase another cow and food for the cows as well. He believes that expanding his farm with the loan will generate more income for his family. He is grateful for this opportunity and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and food for the cows.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana inicio la carrera de auxiliar de enfermería en el instituto campo alto, a un año de estudios en plena mitad de la carrera diana se ve sin recursos suficientes para continuar, así pues diana quiere un prestamo para  seguir estudiando la carrera de auxiliar de enfermería que ella piensa que es el futuro profesional para ella. 

Entonces empieza a plantearse varios aspectos significativos, como el crecimiento personal, profesional y laboral, la colaboración a los padres en un futuro de manera económica y a nivel salud, los planes a futuro son ascender de rango, estudiar otra carrera como pediatra y seguir ejerciendo. 
Diana piensa que seria bueno que alguien la ayudara por que se ve  afectado por la economía del  hogar por esta razón acude a kiva para una ayuda económica a la carrera.
texts.en: Diana began studying as a nursing assistant in high school, and one year into the studies she is halfway to her career. Thus, she began to improve various significant aspect of her life, such as personal, professional, and occupational growth, and also a collaboration with her parents for a sound economic and healthy future. Diana does not have sufficient funds to continue, so she wants a loan to keep studying the career of nursing assistant which she believes is her future. Her future plans are to study for another career like pediatrician and continue practicing. Diana thinks it would be good if someone were to help her as she has been affected by the economy of her home; for this reason, she has come to Kiva for financial help in her career.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Diana Catherine

texts.es:
Ella es diana catherine, desde niños los enseñaron a soñar, pero cuando crecen les enseñan a actuar en busca de los deseos…así mismo transcurrió la vida, entre las exigencias de los padres y los pocos recursos para realizar una carrera después de la secundaria. La vida le ha brindado oportunidades, pero desafortunada mente no todas esas oportunidades las he podido culminar.
