Hoy, hay motivaciones más grandes al lado de ella que la impulsan cada día a superarse y encontrar el éxito que busca. 
No habla del trabajo, si no del hermoso hijo de 3 años que le permite cada día visualizar un futuro exitoso. Tal vez en un pasado no habían las razones suficientes para pensar en la superación personal, pero cuando sabe que otra vida depende de ella y de lo que le pueda aportar todo cambia.
Por eso, ha decidido que la mejor forma de brindar una estabilidad a la familia, es adquiriendo conocimientos, preparándose intelectualmente en un área de trabajo, desempeñarse de forma honesta, y lo mas importante, aplicar los estudios para el bienestar de los demás. 
A lo largo de la vida ha comprendido que la felicidad de las personas transforma nuestra forma de ver el mundo, dejando de lado pensamientos negativos, miedos, envidias, guerras, conflictos y todas las cosas que cada día están llevando a que se destruya la paz entre nosotros. 
El anhelo más grande es poder cumplir todas las metas en los estudios, luchar constantemente por aprender, culminar satisfactoriamente la carrera, abrir un mundo de posibilidades, ayudar a los demás con los conocimientos, ser independiente, tener el propio negocio y especializarse en lo que más le gusta.
Por ultimo quiere agradecerle inmensamente a Dios por la nueva oportunidad que le está brindando, a la familia por el apoyo incondicional y a kiva por la ayuda económica  para cumplir los proyectos.
texts.en:
They teach children to dream, but when they grow up they teach them to go in search of what they want... likewise life passes by, between the struggles of parents and the scarce resources to make a career after high school. Life has offered Diana Catherine opportunities, but unfortunately she has not been able to seize all of these opportunities. 

Today she has greater motivation on her side that pushes her every day to excel and find the success she is looking for. She does not talk about work, but rather of her beautiful 3 year old son who helps her every day to visualize a successful future. Perhaps in the past there were not good enough reasons to think about personal achievement, but when she knows that another life depends on her and what she is capable of, everything changes. 

For this reason, she has decided that the best way to offer stability to her family is to acquire knowledge, preparing herself intellectually in a career field, performing honestly, and most importantly, applying those studies to the well-being of those who count on her. 

Throughout life she has learned that personal happiness transforms the way we view the world, setting aside negative thoughts, fears, jealousy, wars, conflicts, and everything that destroys peace among us. 

Her greatest desire is to achieve all her goals in her studies, fight constantly to learn, to satisfactorily have a career, open a world of possibilities, help those around her to understang, to be independent, to have her own business and specialize in what she likes best.   

Finally, she wants to thank God immensely for the new opportunity he is offering, her family for their unconditional support, and Kiva for the economic help to complete her plans.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Durley

texts.es: Ella es durley, decidió estudiar esta carrera porque tuvo que ver a una amiga como se sentía de mal por el aspecto físico que tenia, es una persona que no le gusta ver a los demás sufrir y menos por las cosas físicas, a si que es en ese momento donde durley toma la decisión de educarse para poder ayudar a otros,   busca los mejores en educación y encontró que  Campo Alto es una gran institución para ella vincularse, pero ya que los costos de matricula son caros ella decide tener el subsidio que le ofrece kiva, para que ella pueda seguir pagando el estudio y empezar con el proceso de formación, ella motivada por este impulso, tiene el spa con muchas terapias y alternativas para mejorar el autoestima de las personas que se sientan mal con ellas mismas o con su aspecto físico, la primera paciente es una amiga, quien esta dichosa de todas las alternativas que tiene para mejorar el aspecto físico y autoestima y así lograr volver  a enamorar a  el esposo, Pero  que sorpresa que se lleva la señora durley, y es que no solo pudo ayudar a otros con su autoestima si no que genero empleo y mas familias se ven beneficiadas, lo mejor de esta empresa es el sustento económico que ella tiene para poder ayudar a la familia también.
texts.en:
Durley decided to study this degree because she had to see a friend who felt bad because of her physical appearance. She is a person who does not like to see others suffer, especially not for physical reasons. In that moment, Durley decided to educate herself so that she would be able to help others. She looked for the best educational institutes and found that Campo Alto is a great institution which she could connect with. There the process began. 

Motivated by this impulse, Durley has many spa therapies and alternatives to improve the self esteem of people who feel bad about themselves or about their physical appearance. Her first patient was her friend, Martha, who is happy with all of the alternatives which she has to improve her physical appearance and her self-esteem, making her husband fall in love again. 

It was a surprise for Durley to find that she could not only help others with their self-esteem, but also generate employment. More families have been benefited by this. The best part about this company is the financial support that she has so that she can also help her family.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is 47 years old, a refugee and married with two sons. The family lives in an IDP settlement. She has been raising fruit trees (such as persimmon and quince) for 15 years and has gained good skills in this area. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. The family gets additional earnings when her husband works as a laborer. In his free time, he helps Dilara to raise the trees. 

Dilara likes her job very much. She takes care of her fruit trees like a mother and raises them properly without any pesticides or harmful medicines. Then she sells the fruit at the local bazaar. Everybody likes sweet persimmon and quince used for health purposes from her garden.

The climate where Dilara lives is very serve and harmful to her garden. Every winter, Dilara loses fruit after the strong winds and snow. She applied for 2,000 AZN to build a strong and warm greenhouse. She wants to keep her garden as safe as she possibly she can.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Confianza En Dios Group

texts.en:
Rose is one of the members of the Confianza En Dios 1, 2, 3 and 4 group, which is located in the resort city of La Romana in one of the communities without many resources. It is surrounded by sugarcane fields, also called batey. A majority of the inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic to improve their quality of life. She is a dedicated mother who has five children who live with her and her long-term partner. 

Rose has done different jobs to help her partner with the household necessities and bring in extra income. She wants to accomplish one of her most difficult goals - to have her own home. She is very excited to receive her seventh loan with Esperanza International. She will invest the loan in purchasing different types of clothing for women and men, cosmetics, and especially women's accessories. She has worked in selling clothing for many years and with this loan, she plans to grow her business by adding different products to bring it to another level. 

She can then use her profits to make changes in her life, including saving money, purchasing a house and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and others to sell.

loans.name: Perezi

texts.en: Perezi is a 52-year-old married man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is a pineapple farmer and earns additional income from selling produce. Climate change and lack of means of transport for his products are his major challenges, though he desires to educate his children and diversify his business to banana production. Perezi intends to use this loan to buy more land for banana production.

loans.use: to buy more land for banana production.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana was originally from Brazil and chose to attend Boston University in order to pursue her passion for the field of communications. During her time there, she founded a translation company, Mass Translations, which works to help coordinate English and Portuguese speakers.

Juliana hopes to continue working on international projects similar to her experience with the Conference at the Department of Education in Washington D.C., in which 65 delegates from Brazil came to discuss different ideas and concerns surrounding education. 

She hopes to continue to expand her business by hiring additional translators, purchasing translating equipment to facilitate translations on a larger level, and increase opportunities for her to work.

loans.use: to hire translators and purchase additional equipment

loans.name: Fenehas Jason

texts.en: Fenehas Jason is aged 34 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child and his wife. He earns additional income from farming and cattle keeping. He saved money from farming and started business so as to fight poverty and meet his family's increasing demands. Price fluctuation and bad roads affect his business. He desires to buy a tipper lorry for easier transportation. Fenehas Jason will use this loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Karaci

texts.en:
Karaci, age 27, is married, with one child, living in Hoima, Uganda. He earns additional income from an electronics and music system business he started to be able to meet his family's needs and other essentials. He has a dream of buying a truck to ease transportation of his products to the city, despite being challenged by inadequate capital to expand his business.

Karaci wants a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates, paints and polish for production. Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "I was unable to study beyond elementary school due to financial difficulties. I joined my brother-in-law who was a master carver, specializing in traditional African objects. Since 1999, I've worked independently with ten experienced carvers. We use a hardwood known as sese for carving our masks. We use sandpaper and polish to achieve a smooth object of good quality. I use paint, metal plates and sometimes clay to decorate and preserve our works." "I am very grateful to all of the people who have contributed to funding my microcredit. When I wake up every morning, I wonder why God would create people that help others they've not met before, to alleviate their problems through financial assistance to uplift their business. God will bless you all." Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3571

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates, paints and polish for production.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a Ghanaian artisan who works with wood to craft accent tables, African masks and decor items. He would like to invest in wood and other materials for his designs. Frank has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "I used to assist another carver at his workshop and I used to ask him so many questions! His answer was always the same, 'Just learn – this is a good skill to have.' I now have apprentices under my care. I think I have a sense of intuition with this art, and whenever it comes, I take advantage of it and put it to work." "I thank you all so much for this micro-credit, and pray that you will continue to help me." Use the link below to view Frank's wood sculptures and African masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4790

loans.use: to invest in wood and other materials for his designs.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescado desde hace varios años, los pescados los comercializa en su hogar y de forma ambulante, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más redes para pescar, anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente. Maria desea darle una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old, and she lives in a rented house with her husband and children. She has been working as a fisherman and selling fish for several years. She sells the fish at her home and on foot; and with her earnings from her sales, and the help of her husband, she manages to pay for some of their household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fishing nets, hooks, and other equipment that is necessary for fishing on a daily basis. Maria would like to give her family a better life in which they could have everything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets, hooks, and other equipment.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim is a 22-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and helps them as much as he can. He works as a laborer in his region. Last year, he helped the community by repairing a big broken water pipe. His earnings for this were only 200 AZN.

Water is one of the most important elements of human life. People cannot live without water. They drink it, use it for washing, and to raise their gardens and crop fields. During a severe winter, the water pipe broke again and caused a lot harm for the region. Now most of the houses cannot use their water.

Alim applied for 2,000 AZN in order to by all the needed tools and finish repairing as soon as possible. It is a hazard for his house, which is situated next to the pipe. He wants to attract a professional repairer for this work and also needs to repair his house.

loans.use: to repair the main water pipe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is 48 years old and married with two sons. He is an IDP and lives with his family in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and she raises his sons. He is a product and food seller who has been working in a small shop for 20 years. His monthly income is 180 AZN. He sells bread, butter, cookies, water, snacks, flour etc. 

People attend Mehdi's shop every morning, when they want to buy freshly baked bread or other daily products that are in high demand.

Though Mehdi's shop is very nice, the assortment isn't wide enough. He applied for 2,000 AZN in order to supply more daily products and expand his business. He wants his customers to find everything they need and keep them satisfied with a wide assortment of products. He applied for a loan for the second time and has a positive client history.

loans.use: to supply more daily products and expand his product assortment.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
In June, 2012, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Vision received a loan through Friendship Bridge funded by Kiva investors. Last May, the group successfully paid it back in full! Currently, the twelve members of the Trust Bank are requesting an additional loan, funded by Kiva investors through Friendship Bridge.

This Trust bank is located in the hills of San Francisco El Alto in the department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. The local economy thrives on hundreds of small family-owned and operated clothing fabricators. People in the area are also engaged in weaving as well as animal husbandry.

Florinda is a 40-year-old married member of the Trust Bank. She has six children who range in age from 7 months to 15 years. Florinda and her husband are both tailors and produce tee-shirts. Due to high demand, Florinda is requesting a new loan which she will use to invest in a new sewing machine. It is important for her to keep her production line moving. Florinda is so grateful to have access to working capital which not only benefits her but also her family. She realizes the importance of education and wants to keep her children in school.

The ladies of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Vision have created a strong circle of support with each other. In each monthly meeting, they emphasize the confidence and accountability that they have with one another. Their goal to continue together for many more loan cycles and maintain an excellent credit record. In addition, they are gaining a lot of useful knowledge each month with the Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who presents various educational trainings on relevant and useful themes like money management and budgeting, nutrition and health, women’s rights and self-esteem. It is the combination of the loans and education that makes the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge so useful for the women. They can step into a more prosperous, successful and educated future, ensuring that future generations will not have the same struggles as they have experienced. They want to share that they are very grateful to Kiva investors for believing in them and funding their loans.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is 55 years old and married, with a daughter and two sons. He has been building irrigation canals for 25 years. He knows everything about irrigation and building canals. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

The region where Nadir lives has a high demand for water, because there are many gardens, farms, crop fields and plantations. People try to establish strong irrigation for their products. 

Though Nadir has a hard job, his monthly income is very low and is not enough to cover a big family's demands. He applied for 2,000 AZN in order to buy new tools for irrigation canal systems and make them better. This is his third loan and he has a very positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new tools for an irrigation canal system.

Emalyn has been in business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Emalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Joan Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Joan Rose requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell to customers. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Joan Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 53 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom are in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business farming calamansi (bitter oranges) in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fe has been farming calamansi for twenty years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arceli has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Arceli would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  stock items such as shampoo, canned goods, vinegar, sanitary napkins, and soy sauce to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has operated the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.

Lelanie has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from retailing pre-paid mobile load.

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 62 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Pacita has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Sharon is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc., for her fishing  business.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:

Analyn has paid off four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been in her roofing business for two years and also earns an income from farming coconuts.

Analyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional roofing material to sell

loans.name: Anna Marie

Anna Marie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from retail of pre-paid loads.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, soap, noodles, etc.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Analiza

loans.name: Aileen

Aileen has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and farming rice.

Aileen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55-years-old and married with two children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional goods for her general store.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.name: Maelynn

texts.en:

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Maelynn is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like spices, noodles, milk, coffee, creamer, etc. for her general store business.

Maelynn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Susan

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mariza is borrowing 9,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mariza has been farming vegetables for 3 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nena

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

Lorilie is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

Josie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.name: Raquel

Raquel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Raquel has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marilyn has an oyster culture business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Marilyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, a binder and other equipment for her oyster culture business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, a binder and other equipment for her oyster culture business

loans.name: Grelyn

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benita

Benita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from meat vending.

Benita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:

Lorenza has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

In the future, Lorenza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.name: Cynthia

Cynthia is 54 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cynthia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, noodles, spices, meat, etc., for her food production business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, noodles, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like shells, wire, etc. for her handicraft business.

Lucy has been in this business for 13 years. Lucy earns more income from her general store.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like shells and wire for her business

texts.en:
Jenfer is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenfer is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenfer has a business selling Boardwalk and Avon products in the Philippines. Jenfer requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more Boardwalk and Avon products like shoes, deodorant, body spray and shampoo to sell.

Jenfer has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase Boardwalk and Avon products like shoes, deodorant, body spray, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. 

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy more items to sell like shampoo, fabric conditioner, laundry soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as those she is requesting a loan to buy. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like shampoo, fabric conditioner, laundry soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc.
